content.description:
I got on this one thinking it was Black Rose.  Half way up with no offwidth gear I realized my mistake.   

  This is a true offwidth, so if you're tired of all those perfect little finger cracks maybe it's worth checking out.  Not nearly as classic as its neighbor.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the same enclave that Black Rose starts at.

content.description: Steep jugs lead to right trending face holds above the Silver Pond. A single knifeblade protects the balancy crux.
content.location: Start on a ledge above water appx. 100 ft left of Black Rose. A horizontally leaning small pine tree marks the top of the climb.

content.description: Another short, fun one that you might as well do since you have the rappel rigged! Traverse right above the water and climb the left-facing corner. The crux is a tricky hand jam half-way up.

A delightful and unique climb that starts to the right of Black Rose. Some slippery and tricky face climbing at the start leads to an excellent crack that combines with critical face holds to keep the  rating reasonable. Key placements protect the climb throughout, but at the start are hard to find.
content.protection: The upper crack protects on wires and small to medium cams, but the bottom is the crux for protection. A variety of small Tri-cams and opposition RPs can get you off the ground. Don't miss the horizontally slotted small stopper (#3?) that protects the pull over the overhang.

content.description: Climb blocky jugs through the line of least resistance. A fun introduction to the Forks.
content.protection: A single set from #.4 - #3 Camalot, Slings
content.location: Directly left of Traveling Violin Maker

content.description: Black Rose is a unique and enjoyable route with good pro. The route is located next to the Silver Pond and usually best reached by rigging a rap line from the ledges above, then rapping into the higher dry boulders just below the route (depending on water level). Climb up the back corner to reach the big black roof, then perform a traverse right and out under the roof. From there, follow double-cracks up to reach the ledges above.
content.protection: Set of nuts, assortment of cams from small to #2 Camalot size. The rappell to the base of the route requires pro (medium to large) in the cracks above the route.

content.description: The Obsidian Wall, located near the Silver Pond, is the northernmost part of the canyon. The rock on this wall is darker than the rest of the canyon, and nearly black. One of the canyon's classic moderate routes, The Black Rose (5.8+) is located here. In general, you will have to rappel in to the bottom of routes here, as the pond normally contains water during the climbing season. A little care (and a partner spotting for you) will keep your rope out of the soup!
